intro: Chaerophyllum calabricum, commonly known as the Sicilian cow parsley, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant features slender stems and small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels. Its leaves are finely divided and often have a mild, spicy scent. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands and grassy areas.
